Reviews.Title: “Good place for visit the city”
Reviews.Author: Eduard1970
Reviews.Content: I stayed in july 2010 in this hotel for 4 nights.The purpose was to visit Madrid.It was a good experience because we were with friends and we enjoyed the whole 5 days. Plus:good hotel with 2 rooms appartments ,dishwasher,laundry washing machine,terrace,bar open till night,good connection with city center,quiet neighborhood,free parking,supermarket near by, free shuttle to the airport, good value for money Minus:no plates and cutlery,20 min to town by bus and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Could not wait to leave!”
Reviews.Author: IL0veNature
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this place when I got stuck in Madrid because of the ash cloud and because my other hotel (Axxor Barajas) could no longer accommodate me. The price was about the same, but the difference immense. The apartment was cold, wind was howling trough. There was a fully equipped kitchen yet no plates and cutlery. The bed was not comfortable. Breakfast felt like I was in a gymnasium. No fresh coffee, cold atmosphere, average quality. Internet connection in the hotel kept dropping. Reception was also not overly welcoming. I ran out and looked for a new hotel the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, convenient stop-over near airport”
Reviews.Author: Debbie S
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the hotel at the beginning and end of a 2 week trip to Spain. It was very convenient and very good value for money. The one problem with the hotel was the difficulty navigating, with strange turns and junctions on very busy roads. We solved the problem by paying a taxi to fllow them to the hotel once we knew we were near by. So- if you have no satellite navigation equipment... do not be brave- pay and follow a taxi. We were very pleased with our choice. Large, pleasant rooms, reasonable breakfast and late night snack/bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Consider this one”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyColonel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice (2 nights, then 1 night, two weeks later). I really didn't find anything negative. In fact, one early morning at 0230, I went down to the front desk to complain about my neighbours being a little too talkative and they sent security up immediately to tell them to shut up. This is basically a businessman's hotel with underground parking. They have small suites with a fully equipped kitchen, clothes washer, dish washer and flat screen TV (no English stations). The wifi is very fast and the breakfast buffet is above average. There is absolutely NO english language information in the hotel (when are the Europeans ever going to smarten up and realize tourists patronize places where they feel even a little at ease). For shopping, there's a Carrefour hypermarket and a Mercadonna store 1 block west in a very large plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Had a short stop over at madrid airport and decided to try this hotel - mistake!! Arrived in Madrid at 10pm and had to wait 50 mins for the shuttle bus. Rang the hotel only to be told it was nearly there - but it wasn't. Arrived at hotel eventually and queued to check in. The surly receptionist asked to see my daughters passport and told us that as she was 13 (it was her bithday the day before) we would have to pay for her to be in our room. When we booked we were not told this so refused to pay. After much messing around she reluctantly agreed to waiver the charge but was obviously not happy. By this time there was a large queue behind us so it was all a bit embarissing to say the least. Eventually got to the 'suite' and it was horrid. Basic with paper thin walls, it just looked awful. The kitchen didnt have a single plate, cup, or glass - whats the point in having a kitchen ! Bedroom was small with a teeny window and the most vile bed I have slept on in a while. Limp and lumply pillow which didnt smell very clean and the bedding consisted of a sheet and a horrid manky looking blanket with a thin and unattractive cover on top. My daughters bed was shoved up a corner in the lounge and was equally horrrid. Would have complained but by this time we only had about 5 hours to get some sleep so decided to get on with it. However next doors TV could be heard through the walls and ny husband and I were constanly itching - maybe the blankets?? Ended up hardly sleeping. I am not a constant complainer, if you look at my other reviews you will see that but I would say only go to this hotel if there are no other options, we hated it and it spoilt the end of our holiday. Only paid 60 euro but dont think it was even worth that. Stay away, much nicer options nearby

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, clean, near airport but with a few negatives.”
Reviews.Author: Nevisto
Reviews.Content: This is a 3* hotel, so we expected 'average' We were pleasantly surprised as we booked one of their suites for 3 people (me, wife, grown-up duaghter) expecting a 1 bed unit with sofabed. They gave us Room 316. Imagine our surprise when we saw it was a 2 bed; 2 bath; lounge & kitchen with machines. Unfortunately, besides cupboards, there was nothing else. No crockery/cutlery/glassware/ kettle/toaster. You get the idea. There is no room service, but the bar/cafe is open until 3pm and they were o.k. for me to take tea/coffee/food to the suite. They have the worst pillows I have ever tried (unsucessfully) to sleep on. No information book in the room and only Spanish TV. In conclusion, if you brought your own pillows (or used their very squashy ones) and didn't need to use the kitchen, this is a good place to stay, especially overnight if you flying the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously impressed!”
Reviews.Author: barrett65
Reviews.Content: Excellent buffet breakfast, helpful staff, lovely products in bathroom, massive towels. Would absolutely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “60 Euros for a suite - what was I thinking??!”
Reviews.Author: RobertGirona_Spain
Reviews.Content: It's not really at the airport, but in a suburban mall, rooms are tacky with poor beds, a small sitting room (not much more than a sofa and a TV), poor bathroom, noisy installations. OK, it was cheap but i would have slept better in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Kris Aeropuerto Suites offers value for money”
Reviews.Author: MrsPiket
Reviews.Content: Kris Aeropuerto Suites opened in 2008 and is an adequate business hotel, located in Poligono Industrial Las Mercedes, an uninteresting neighbourhood full of offices close to Madrid airport. Shuttle service to the airport is complimentary. The historic centre of Madrid is quite far. Next door is the Axor Barajas hotel which is more luxurious. Also next door is the Axor Feria hotel which is comparable to Kris Aeropuerto. The hotel is accessible from A2 highway but even with a GPS not easy to find. Parking in the street in front of the door is free. Staffs are friendly. Kris Aeropuerto Suites rooms are comfortable and beds are OK. We had a suite with separate living room. Decor throughout the hotel is modern, buffet breakfast is OK. The restaurant is unimpressive but the food served is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: yohannsetna
Reviews.Content: I really found this hotel to be an excellent choice. I was in Madrid for a race weekend at Jarama circuit near the airport so was looking for a clean comfy hotel a short drive from the track. Great free Wifi. The rooms were all mini-apartments with a bedroom, bathroom, living room & a full kitchen with washing machine, stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher & a full-size refrigerator. I only wish they had provided some instruction books for the washing machine in english, as the controls were all in Spanish. Breakfast was excellent, secure parking & a huge mall just 5 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the airport”
Reviews.Author: Brobb100
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for it's convenience to the airport and free shuttle bus as had an early flight. Used bus and subway to get to the center of Madrid without too much hassle. Modern hotel with spacious suites, clean, well equipped (although the kitchen had no cutlery or crockery!). Close to a shopping mall with supermarket. Free parking outside (not sure if underground was free or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Iowayankee20
Reviews.Content: The Suites Kris was a great, very clean hotel near the airport. If you are looking to stay in town, it may not be the best (metro is nearby but it's a long ride in) but the shuttle to the airport was on time and efficient. The shuttle does fill up during the earlier times, so make sure you either call ahead with your time (if checking in late in the day) or tell the desk as soon as you check in. We ended up having to take an earlier shuttle because the 8am one was full. The rooms were awesome! There was a kitchen, a living room, and 2 bedrooms in the room we booked. Very spacious and very clean. The breakfast was also outstanding- eggs, bacon, breads, and snacks that were prepackaged (so you can take a few with you). Overall, it was a great place to stay when we were on our way out of Spain.

Reviews.Title: “is a good hotel to stay before you leave Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: CaliLatina
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel to stay for the night before you leave Madrid airport. There is shuttle free which is certainly a plus - but just bear in mind you have to booked it and let the receptionist know aprox when would you like to take it . the payment of the hotel room includes full breakfast buffet which is also a plus as you do not need to worry about another thing too. the breakfast offered is really good. and the food they offered in the hotel is not expensive - i bought a burger with chips with egg and bacon very large... for just only 6 euros. a coffee could cost you 1.50 euros i mean is really ok to pay The apartmen/room of the hotel is ok. is not small one. good when you travel with kids as you will not feel very comprised. not recommended if you would like to visit madrid centre as is far away from there. if you would like to visit madrid centre i highly recommended to go to mrl apartments - i was in one and it was superb! The only thing that make me a bit uneasy about this hotel is that i am sure i lelft my mobile phone on the bed however when i contacted them they said they couldn't find anything.... so my luck ah! but just a sour experience for me and an advice for you guys to ensure double check the room before you leave and ensure you do not leave anything.... as it appears they will not find anything after that!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value close to Madrid Airport”
Reviews.Author: travelerww
Reviews.Content: Took the metro from the Chamartin train station to the airport (2 euros, 25 minutes ). Hotel minibus comes by the the T2, T1 terminals arrivals level for pick ups every half hour. Check-in was fast & friendly. The suite was clean with its own climate control and is composed of a bedroom (with king size bed), sitting room (with couch, tables & flat screen TV)& bathroom (small but adequate). Did not bring my laptop to try the free wifi in rooms but did use the free internet connected computer stations adjacent to the lobby. The breakfast buffet is completely self service (opens at 7am sharp) and had a very large selection of hot and cold foods. Next to the front desk is a coffee machine and cookies for those who have to leave the hotel earlier. Guests should reserve their minibus seats when checking in. The driver gets a list of passengers & checks them off as they board before leaving for the airport (approx. 10 minutes to T1). Paid 55 euros buffet breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, breakfast is not served until 07.00”
Reviews.Author: AllenTorrevieja
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking we considered the price to be good value as it included breakfast and we knew that we would have a consideerable wait until we checked in to our destination with no known prospect of having the opportunity to obtain food. It was a considerable blow to fing that although ther is a 24 hour shuttle service is was impossible to get even a continental breakfast without using the vending machines. The drinks seemed to be highly priced and the food in the restaurant only acceptable. It took two calls to have the air conditiioning switched on and controlable.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water!”
Reviews.Author: McTravelalot
Reviews.Content: I have selected this hotel based on price and shuttle bus from Madrid airport. I arrived at MAD at 11pm but checked in at 1am. Painful waiting with other frustrating travelers for hotel shuttle. Forget taxi drivers. They will not take you in their car, unless you are going to far away places. Later we found out why we had to wait that long for the bus. Apparently, they have only one shuttle bus and the hotel is good 15 minutes away driving time from the airport. I have nothing against the shuttle driver. He was probably the nicest person that I have dealt at this hotel. As I have mentioned it above, I arrived at the hotel at 1am. My first impression of this hotel was; “converted offices into a hotel”. Check in was very fast and I asked for 3am wake up call. Yeap, I was planning on being at this hotel until 4am since I had flight to catch at 6am. The check in clerk put me down on the shuttle bus list for 4am departure. I went to my room, which was on the third floor. My room looked like typical European two bedroom apartment. Nothing special but better than average. My bedroom was very cold and even setting the thermostat to high temperature it remained cold until my check out. Room with the TV and sofa was very hot so I stayed there for some time before I went to my bedroom. I did not like the fact that there was no TV set in the bedroom. However, on the other side, TV in the sofa room had only about eight channels and all of them were in Spanish. I was very tired (16 hours on the road), but because of the cold room I could not sleep. I spent rest of the time in this hotel flipping thorough Spanish channels and staying warm in the sofa room. When I got my wake up call, I went to the bathroom to take the shower. To my disappointment, there was no hot water, not even warm water. Immediately I went downstairs, explained my situation and asked for room replacement so I could take shower. My request was denied! I was told that I should open the water and wait few minutes for it to warm up. After running water for 30 minutes, I gave up, took my stuff and went downstairs to catch my shuttle bus. There was no traffic at that hour so I got to my terminal in 10 minutes. I will not stay in this hotel again for sure. I do not want to take a chance with the cold water, nor do I want to deal with rude receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, but the location is ugly”
Reviews.Author: Photos_On_The_Road
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, modern rather than impersonal. The rooms are large (one room with beds, one room with sofas and TV plus bathroom) and fully equipped. The location is quiet, robably too quiet: there is absolutely nothing around you, apart from a big shopping mall 5 minutes walk away. If you want a beer or a tapa, the only choice the hotel's bar. The bus shuttle service advertised by the hotel is a fake: you won't be able to locate it when you arrive at the airport, and you're very likely to miss it on the way to the airport since the bus is in reality a mini van and can load only few persons. The alternative is a Ero 20 ride to the airport.
